page.title: 10Mortimer Farm Shop
page.content: The shop made from an old cowshed has a cobbled floor and wooden shelves. It sells vegetables and home-grown fruit as well as produce from around the village or from overseas, fetched from the market near London Airport. New potatoes cost 10p/lb, tomatoes cost 48p/lb, strawberries cost 56p/lb, peaches 15p each, carrots 20p/lb, lettuces 20p each. Wholefoods like cereals, nuts, dried fruit, spices and herbs sell very well and so do duck eggs and Free Range eggs which cost 90p per dozen. Left over fruit and vegetables are made into jam, chutney or pickles by local people to sell in the shop. Outside the shop they sell plants, shrubs and herbs from their gardens. The shop is open from 9-6 on Thursday, Friday, Saturday in the winter and daily from 9-7 in the summer. This is a family business.
